website_summaries.verdict: A long-lasting charge on a razor that covers a lot of area quickly and provides Panasonic's closest shave earns this model our highest marks.
pros: The symmetrical alignment of the 5 blades makes for a nice feature that covers a lot of the face quickly
The battery can last as long as 3 weeks on a full charge without losing any shaving power
We are impressed by the close shave provided by the 14,000 cuts per minute motor, as close as what is available from many manual blades
cons: Charging the battery too often may shorten the life of the battery

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning Station Failed
customer_reviews.text: Shaver is excellent and provides a quick, close shave. The pump in the cleaning station failed within a year which is the reason for three stars. Updated: now the station will not stop drying the device. It is extremely hot to the touch and can not be used.
customer_reviews.author: Oolon Colluphid

customer_reviews.title: Received broken, filthy and used!
customer_reviews.text: Received this today and was extremely disappointed upon opening the box as the razor was not only used but it was filthy and broken. I didn’t pay $200 to receive someone’s used dirty broken razor and now I have to go out of my way to return the thing. I should have just gone to the store and bought it at least then I’d know it wasn’t used and dirty!
customer_reviews.author: CARRIE HERWEYER

customer_reviews.title: Razor Performance Degrades Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Initially razor worked very well. Had to replace head and blades within four months. Battery losing capacity. Razor hummed when new, now sounds like reluctant hedge clippers. Seems to have been designed as a disposable razor. Attempted to contact Panasonic on-line regarding warranty. They are MIA. Amazon should not do business with Panasonic. You could not find worse customer service. Panasonic did replace the razor after much effort, with an upgrade. Time will tell about its performance.
customer_reviews.author: nz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Seeing the commercials and watching videos I thought that someone had finally invented an electric razor that would completely illuminate the need for the old-fashioned shaving. It worked great for the first week and then has gone downhill considerably ever cents... I wash it every time I use it and follow the maintenance instructions to the tea. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T. Pesola

customer_reviews.title: Frankly, painful to use
customer_reviews.text: Saddens me to find that this product does everything well except it's primary purpose: give a good shave. I invested in a more expensive razor because I thought it would help with my sensitive skin and shave closer but this was much much worse than the $60 Norelco I've been using for the past 3 years. As a result I've turned back to that razor and this one occupies a shelf untouched. I can't recommend this product despite everyone else's great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: David Lamb

customer_reviews.title: NOT A CLOSE SHAVE
customer_reviews.text: Guys, save you money. After you shave with this razor you have to save again with another ( I use my old Norelco) in order to get a close shave. And you can buy 3 Norelco's for what one of these Panasonic units cost. Also I think this unit will cause you to have permanent loss of hearing it is so noisy. Be informed, wish I had been
customer_reviews.author: hal

customer_reviews.title: Poor Panasonic Support
customer_reviews.text: Razor Didn't cut well after one month. Tried to call Panasonic support by phone and recording said "may charge $9.95 for call." Then recording said NO PHONE SUPPORT for razors. Then gave me a hyperlink address to go to on my computer. I went to that address and they wanted $1 to chat and wanted me to put in my charge card information. I would not do that! Panasonic has VERY POOR SUPPORT.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine S.

customer_reviews.title: Best razor ever!!
customer_reviews.text: After 23 years ( not a typo ), my Panasonic linear 3D finally quit. I purchased a Braun series 9 for $250 and i ended up returning it simply on the basis that the shave closeness was only on par with my original Panasonic?! The Braun was exceptionally quiet but didn’t impress on the closeness as compared to my 23 year old Panasonic. After purchasing the new arc 5, I understand and believe that the superior motor speed and 5 blades do matter! It’s awefully impressive to think that I will most likely have to own only 2 razors that are flawless machines for more than half my life. Bravo Panasonic!!
customer_reviews.author: mason w wauda

customer_reviews.title: Planned obsolescence sucks
customer_reviews.text: Man, it would be AMAZING if you could buy a PREMIUM product, not some cheap crap, and actually HAVE a premium product that LASTS! Unfortunately, this is no better than those cheap products as its planned obsolescence allowed it to fail right after warranty expires. Like many others, the pump on the cleaning station died shortly after the 2 years, so I have a fancy looking razor stand. My suggestion is save the money and avoid any of these "Premium Razors" that offer the cleaning station. Hell, might want to avoid the product altogether if this is the quality you get.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Smith

customer_reviews.title: This razor does not do the job.
customer_reviews.text: It takes me longer to shave with this razor than with a regular old fashioned razor. Before purchasing I looked at many reviews, most of which gave it an excellent rating. Even Consumer Reports gives it a high rating. I don't understand this because for me it consistently misses many hairs making me go over certain areas repeatedly. Many times there are hairs that it just won't pick up and cut. If I don't shave for 2 or 3 days, it's impossible to get a clean shave. It just doesn't pick up and cut the hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Using electric shaver last 30-35 years or so ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally i liked the first few shaves but after several shaves i realized, it was struggling too much for flat or those trouble ones you have in your face. I had to go over 6-7 times even that wasn't enough, many times that i have to use regular razor to cut remaining hair. When shaves it shaves closest i ever seeing but troubling finishing the job completely. Maybe you can have better luck with it (different shape of face, hair etc.) It's going back and i won't try foil shaver again.
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Well after alloted time recommended by manufacturer for this thing to get use to your shaving, it sucks !!! I am back to using my 9 year old Norelco (that this was suppose to replace), to get all the stubble, left behind by this waste of money Panasonic !!! I should have trusted my gut rather then reviews......Very, Very, Disappointed !!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth F.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but really cheap perforing razor.a
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor assuming it would be a good quality razor and give me a clean close shave..WRONG!! The razor is very noisy, hard to clean, loses battery life quickly and provides for a poor quality shaving The best I can give this poor designed and performing razor is a 1-star rating. Update... Its even worse than I thought, so i just lowered my rating to 1-star!íí
customer_reviews.author: G. Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Pulls your whiskers out instead of cutting them.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Norelco shavers for about 50 years and always been happy. The brochure that came with the razor said you might need a month to use to the way it shaves if you're new to Norelco. Ha! that won't apply to me I thought. But I was wrong. This was the most painful shave ever. I kept using this razor way beyond the break-in time and the shave never improved. It felt like it was pulling out my whiskers rather than cutting them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had a Philips rotary shaver that died, and decided to try this shaver because of all the features, etc. I'm very displeased. This thing tears up my neck. No matter how light I press, I can't get it to cut the hair and leave the skin. I never had this issue with the Philips. Additionally, this shaver tends to leave a lot of hairs behind. Finally, the battery life is horrible. Maybe 4-5 shaves and this thing is dead. The 5 year old Philips lasted more shaves. I don't know what the deal with this thing is, but I tried for 6 months and I give up. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Failure of the cleaning station!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this razor June 2018 (~17 months ago). Recently I noticed the cleaning solution was leaking out on to my dresser. After looking closer I see the container that holds the cleaning solution is all cracked, as if the plastic was being affected by heat or something... This always sits on my dresser at room temperature. Not sure what the issue is. I will not be replacing this razor with another Panasonic!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Panasonic (the first still actually works and just needs a can't be found head after 6 years of use). In 5 or 6 years when I need a new unit again, I will have no problem buying another Panasonic over the Braun units I used to buy as not only do the Panasonics last linger, they give me a much closer shave much quicker without pulling hair. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Charles Marsden

customer_reviews.title: No drama shaver
customer_reviews.text: This is a good electric shaver. I have used blades for fifty years and it simply does not shave as close as a blade. But it is quick. Any time you want you can whack off the stubble. No preparation necessary. Just turn it on and run it over your face. No need to soften your stubble in the shower or slather cream all over your face. Men who burn their faces using this shaver need to talk to their pa about how to shave. If I bought it today I wouldn’t buy that silly cleaning tub. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hiemforth

customer_reviews.title: Really a poor shave.
customer_reviews.text: This razor just doesn't get the job done. My old Remington runs circles around it. I couldn't recommend this unit to anyone. Does not shave as fast or as close as the Remington. A real disappointment. They say to use it 30 days or so, but when you do, your return window is closed so you are stuck with a bad product. I will probably throw it out because it isn't much use as a razor.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Hagey

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Arc5 Electric Razor - Next best thing to a non-mechanical Bladed Shave
customer_reviews.text: Received the razor sooner than the promised date and used it for the first time today after charging it. My initial impressions: This is the best electric shaver I have owned and at a very reasonable price. Shaves almost as close as using a Gillett Mach 3 razor. Charge time from 0% to 100% was about 45 minutes. I like that it has a built-in sideburns trimmer that also works flawlessly. There is absolutely no pulling on the whiskers or skin burns. My face is liking this new upgrade. Looking forward to getting lots of use from this razor and hope it lasts/works for several years. Very impressed with my purchase of Panasonic Arc5 Razor.
customer_reviews.author: StanR

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Philips Norelco because the Amazon reviews were right. The replacement shaving heads are awful. I've used the Panasonic for 1 month, and the shave is good. Read the instructions! It takes a light touch to get a close shave. I used to think bearing down would work better. Allow the shaver to work as it was designed. I liked the rotary head design, but they blew it by going cheap on replacement heads. Lost another customer.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: After a month, worst shave I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to try the Panasonic shaver after reading so many amazing reviews. I had used a Panasonic 3 head shaver for past 10 years with good results. The good - this Panasonic shaver is good in the cheek area. The bad - it does not cut well around the chin and especially around the neck. It cuts my Adam’s apple, and shreds my neck. After shaving my neck is red and still several uncut hairs. Customer service encouraged me to continue using the shave as my face needed to get used to it. Actually, it has only gotten worse. Trust me, don’t waste your money and save your face the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bednar

customer_reviews.title: WORST razor I have ever known.  NEVER again Panasonic.
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, this razor deteriorates quickly in both noise and shaving capability. In addition, the floating head is a joke and the razor is just plain awkward to use in tight spots. I bought it in November of 2018 and it's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: BOYOBOYOBOY

customer_reviews.title: No safety blade but great on sensitive skin and frequent shaving
customer_reviews.text: Nothing shaves as closely as a safety blade and I wouldn't expect an electric razor to be a match. After some extensive research to get one for my husband, he's over the moon at being able to shave every two to three days without irritation. I checked with him after every shave for two weeks to see if we needed to return this and try something else and he was happy with this. I appreciate having less, if no stubble to deal with and it helps to know that he's not dealing with cuts and irritation. The self cleaning function is by no means quiet, but very convenient
customer_reviews.author: Keto gourmands

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy it again
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric shaver that wasn’t an economy/travel model. I like it a lot. My facial hair is light as with most Asians. Takes me 1.5-2.5 minutes. Does an excellent job for me. 90% of shave time spent on my chin & area below my chin. Comes with vinyl zipper case, charger & razor. I don’t use it wet. I use a small brush from another shaver to brush leavings from the cutters & cutter deck. Holding the foil cover I rap my fingers, not the foil cap on the sink to dislodge bits from foil/screen. I love this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used two Panasonic razors to death, so I reasoned I should get a third. This one is just like my others, except the head is a bit larger. This makes moving the razor under my double-chin a bit harder and results in a less than perfect shave (I have a reason to lose weight for a closer shave.) The wet/dry feature is nice because it is so easy to clean, just like my previous models. Overall, a good shaver, and if it lasts as long as my previous ones, a good buy, as well.
customer_reviews.author: JJOshiro

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time this morning. I've shaved with a safety razor for several years and used disposables before that. I've always heard that electric shavers (particularly foil shavers like this one) are hard on your skin. I actually got a really wonderful shave this morning, and my skin wasn't irritated and red and with dings like it almost always is with a razor. I think I've found my new mode of shaving. I do feel a little "exfoliated" above the lip this afternoon, but I'm really happy with the great shave I get. I think I'll look forward to shaving, for the first time. (I just noticed the shape is a little phallic, which is always nice.)
customer_reviews.author: SLC 84102

customer_reviews.title: A Real Winner. Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing razor. I've been using safety blades for years after rejecting electric razors but decided to give it another try after a a bout of razor bumps. I shave both head and face. After 2 days the bumps are clearing. This produces a close shave faster than blades (for me anyway). I've tried shaving dry, with water and with aloe vera. All work well. The aloe vera especially. It lubricates and makes cleaning the razor easy under the faucet. Plus it's good for your skin. I always wash my head and face first. 17/20/17 Still working great. I'm using Zest bar soap to shave with. Smooth and quick.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Too disposable to be a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two years and three months. Then the battery capacity began to decline. A month later the battery capacity was zero. I have disassembled it in an attempt to replace the battery to find the insides completely overrun with mold and gunk. The battery ( a Li-ion 680 mAh model) is obviously not meant to be replaced. I expect this kind of thing after four or five years, but not this soon for an item of this expense.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great shave
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foil shaver after years of rotary Philipses. The last 9700 model was the glorious example of bad engineering for a lot of money, so I decided to try Panasonic. Exceptional shave of the face, a bit worse but still very good of the neck. It's technological tour de force, but too many gimmicks, hence 4 stars. Why do I want to know how long it took to shave? Another example: First push of a power button starts sensor mode, the second - normal mode, whatever it means. All in all, it's a great shaver, hope it will serve me well. Japanese products have some quirks but they never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.

customer_reviews.title: $99 bucks down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: Got it because of positive fake reviews. Shaver sharpness didn't last 60 days. The shaver is dull now, and I'm back using disposable razor blades. Would be worth it if it came with 12 easily replaceable blades . Amazon verified members getting paid for fake reviews is upsetting and causes harm to people like me.
customer_reviews.author: Happy New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: For years I've been using a Braun Series 7 with the charging station. I never liked it [see my review] and it began getting cracks in the housing tho never dropped or mishandled. Also very expensive to buy the cleaning cartridges. This Panasonic Arc5 is far superior to the Braun in every way: it gives a clean, comfortable shave, the trimmer actually works [unlike the Braun] and you can clean it with a little liquid soap and running water. I've been using it for about 3 months and I'm very satisfied. I hope it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Mel H

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. My face hurts and had to finish the job with an old $35 razor
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would upgrade but wasn’t the case, not as good as my old $35 razor. Actually one of the worst shaved I’ve had in a long time. Had to finish with my old razor and now my face is irritated like never before. Complete waste of time and money. The reviews are either fake or these people have never tried another electric razor. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Knutz

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver that actually shaves!
customer_reviews.text: I'd used Norelco shavers for over 30 years (since I started shaving) and their quality has just gone down the toilet. It was time to try something else. After looking at reviews, people said that the Arc 4 (the older version) was a great shaver. I was trying to decide on the arc5 or a braun shaver. In the end, I went with the Arc5 and I couldn't be happier. Pros: Fast shaving with no missed hair. I can shave in under a minute. Neat cleaning base. It must be Japanese. :) Integrated trimmer. Cons: Doesn't get quite as close as the Norelco, but doesn't miss hair like the Norelco and it's close enough. Noisy. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rakker

customer_reviews.title: Closest Shave yet.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a Braun Series 9 for 4 years before it malfunctioned. Read lots of reviews and decided to give the Arc5 a try. I also purchased a new Braun Series 9 to compare. I shaved half my face with one and half with the other. I have to say, the Arc5 is definitely a closer shave with far less effort. I will be returning the Braun and sticking to the Arc. It even does a great job around the neck. I always had to cleanup with a blade using the Braun but not with arc.
customer_reviews.author: Ziad

customer_reviews.title: Great Shave!
customer_reviews.text: My Norelco was getting old and needed a new shaver head as I was getting cuts. New heads are pretty expensive and don't have good reviews so I found this Panasonic ES-LV65 shaver on sale and took the plunge as I had a Panasonic many years a go and remember liking it. 1st shave with it was way beyond my expectations - very close and comfortable, far superior to the Norelco. I've had it a week now and it just gets better. Have tried wet shaving with foam as well and couldn't be happier for the price. I've also had very expensive Brauns and in my humble opinion this is even better. Very easy to manually clean. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Braun is better
customer_reviews.text: After using a Braun series 7 for the past 6 years it’s starting to die. Thought I would try a Panasonic. Not impressed. Compared to the Braun the Panasonic is not as well made, is less ergonomic, is not as aggressive at cutting whiskers. The trimmer is on the opposite side of the razor so you need to turn it around to use it and the trimmer is very short so almost useless. I also like the Braun cleaning method better which uses disposable containers rather than little detergent packets you have to mix with water. My plan is to try the Braun series 9.
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: No irritated skin or cuts!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first electric razor, so I do not have much to compare it to. I shave 5-6 days a week for work and a regular razor blade irritated my skin and always had cuts and razor burn. I’ve had this razor for about 30 days now and I’ve had mixed feelings. I’ve tried dry, water and diluted shaving cream. The diluted shaving cream has worked the best. It does a great job on my face. No complaints there. But my neck is a different story. I’m going to keep trying different things on my neck and see what I come up with. BUT it has been very nice not having irritated skin or cuts!!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Poffenberger

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as Butter!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Arc3 that I liked so much that I bought the Arc5! Likes: easy clean just liquid soap and running water, close dry shave, travel lock, one third the price of the Braun series 9 without the base station. I now use the Arc3 to shave my body hair and the Arc5 to shave my facial hair. The Arc5 is more aggressive and bigger physically. Panasonic recommends foil and cutter replacements at least annually. I prefer foil shavers over rotary as foil does not pull on my hair, where for me rotary shavers will pull on my hair. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as a baby’s butt close shave.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Panasonic ES8243A (apparently the ARC4) for several years. I always thought it was a good shave and always use wet with lather. I replace the heads every four or five months. This time rather than replace the heads I purchased the Panasonic ARC5. I have had it for a month and find it to be exceptional. It is a little larger than the 4, but the shave is as good or better than a traditional straight razor. I find the less pressure I use the better the shave. The best I have ever found and I have tried many over the years. It is staying charged longer than the 4.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Jury

customer_reviews.title: Better than Gillette!
customer_reviews.text: Got "perturbed" by the recent Gillette anti-male commercial, so I got the Panasonic electric (Braun, the competitor, is also Proctor and Gamble and I wanted to use a different company) and couldn't be more pleased. It is faster, just as close as the top Gillette razors, and more ecological since you don't throw away all the blades and shaving cream cans. I use hand soap as a preshave and then rinse the razor when done and don't see the need for the costly cleaning accessory. Very pleased -- thank you Gillette!
customer_reviews.author: Speedy1

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long to shave
customer_reviews.text: While this does provide a very close shave my facial hair grows in different directions and it took forever for me to move the razor in every direction to get all the hair. The instructions say to wait for your hair to get used to the new way of shaving and i did, I used it for 6+ months and it just grew more frustrating over time. I left the charger at a hotel and just decided I was tired of the razor anyway and never went back. I switched to a rotating blade electric razor and while it doesn't cut as short I don't have to spend near as much time shaving.
customer_reviews.author: tkbonham

customer_reviews.title: Approving of the best seller status
customer_reviews.text: I have used an electric razor all my life, more the 40 years and it's always been a Norelco. After a recommendation by one of my workmates, I decided to give this unit a try as the blades on the Norelco were dull and the unit was very old and time for an upgrade. First impressions of the Panasonic are spectacular. I know its new and the blades are factory sharp but this give a very close shave in less than half the time. It has a way to go to meet the Norelco's durability and battery life but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Idouglas99

customer_reviews.title: Face Irritated and disappointed in NY/NJ area..
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews which prompted me to purchase the wet/dry Panasonic shaver. I must be in another world, my first time I used it as a wet shaver, and after nearly 30 minutes of going over and over the same areas of my face my face was very irritated and still had hairs visible. Additionally it was near impossible to get close above my upper lip, had to use trimmer which again irritated my upper lip area.. So it’s safe to say as far as I’m concerned it’s another wasted piece of imported garbage!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works better than my other brands used over the years.
customer_reviews.text: I choose Panasonic as a trial over the other major brands like Braun and Norelco. The Norelco brand changed their heads and now difficult to find an OEM replacement rather than a knock-off head. The Braun shaved closer perhaps but even on the lowest setting tended to chew up my fave. The Panasonic is smooth and close enough eliminating the razor burn I used to get with the Braun. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: TheTechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good value solid shaver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver with its self-cleaning module because it was not only cheaper than the Braun equivalent but used no alcohol in the cleaning fluid that prevents shipping to Hawaii. It’s a big shaver with big head. Took me a while to adjust to the size but also because the so-called motor seems to me like an ultrasonic vibration only. But it shaves better than my old Braun although those front neck hairs still need a wet shave with blade every few days. It comes with a travel pouch and seems to hold its charge for more than a week.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAloha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric razor
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Panasonic electric razors for decades and upgraded to the Arc5 when the battery in my Arc4 was starting to go after many many years of daily use. It has only been 2 shaves so far with the Arc5, but I love it as it does a much better job with neck and under chin area where electric's often struggle. The shaving head is larger than the 4 and so far no issues with shaving under the nose, etc. As far as I am concerned, you cant beat Panasonic razors with the linear motors and 14,000 cuts per minute (until the battery is drained). Very ow maintenance and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST ELECTRIC SHAVER I'VE TRIED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use to be a Norelco Man, I have tried several Norelco rotary shavers and non of them have shaved as well, nor as clean, nor as fast as my new Panasonic Arc5... The Norelco's lag in motor performance tended to nick my skin even though they have hypo-allergenic blades and are known to be better for sensitive skin. I now love to shave every morning. The Arc 5 literally shaves all my facial hair in like 20 seconds and it looks super clean...Best of all it has not irritated nor left my skin with a burning sensation! THIS IS THE WAY TO GO GUYS! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU INVEST IN A LIFE CHANGING TECHNOLOGY!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. 007🔱

customer_reviews.title: Leaves hair behind
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is not like other Panasonic shavers I have had. This one doesn't get the job done. Leaves random hairs all over the place and keep trying to get it to get them and end up having to use a manual blade to do it. Also, the "5" blades isn't really 5 blades and they don't cut well up to the edge you might want. I am returning this and wouldn't recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: keith saddoris

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SHAVING MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely loves this machine. He used Noreclo for over 10 years and never wanted to change it. I got this one for him as a gift and he likes it much better than the Noreclo series. It takes him only a few min to shave (very close to skin making his face very smooth) and usually it takes about 10% of the battery for every shave. The charging is VERY fast, too! It fully charges in less than an hour. Finally, it is VERY EASY TO CLEAN which is one of the most important advantages of this great shaving machine.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Works for shaving legs!
customer_reviews.text: I have to use electric razors to shave my legs, because my skin is too sensitive for traditional razors. Over the years, I’ve tried all kinds of electric razors (both men’s and women’s models), and this is by far the closest shave I’ve ever had with an electric razor. I was able to shave my legs completely smooth in about 5 minutes. This razor came packaged nicely, with a leather traveling case and very clear instructions. I hope it lasts for a while- but if it does eventually die, I will buy it again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Outer Foil Issue
customer_reviews.text: After using it for 2 months now I cannot use it as the skin burns. I think the outer foil is damaged. The manufacturer manual says it needs to be changed after a year. But I have one used it for 2 months now and that too once or twice a week. I have reached out to Amazon and they said they will contact the manufacturer. Lets see what the manufacturer says. Will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Extremely Smooth Electric Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to use electric shaver. I had been using a standard razor but decided to try an electric razor because of a small pimple that was causing me to often cut myself during shaving. I remembered using an electric shaver a long time ago and how it would often irritate the skin because it occasionally tug at the hairs, but I have zero skin irritation with this Panasonic electric shaver. I think that that may be due to the fact that this shaver’s blades operate at a very high frequency, so that the hairs are instantly cut without there being enough time to tug at the hairs while one is shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: GIVES a really CRAPPY shave.
customer_reviews.text: I really am doing all consumers a disservice by calling it a shave. I can hold this thing on my face right to the skin and it wont even cut all of my tiny little beard, its a joke. I was cleaning my bathroom found a10 year old norelco charged it up and man it blew this one away. I can't recommend this shaver at all.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Shaver
customer_reviews.text: The Arc5 lv65s is the best electric razor I have ever owned and I have had more than 10 in the last 40 years. All were okay but some cost more than they were worth. The technology and close shave of Arc5 is amazing for a electric shaver. It is easy to clean and charges quickly. I am impressed on how smooth it is. I like using my straight edge razor and the super closeness it gives but that requires longer shaving time which I don't always have. The Arc5 lv65s is great for a travel razor which I do often. This is a wet/dry shaver.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, despite a bit of Sound and Fury
customer_reviews.text: The razor works fine - after the initial fright of having it sound like there is an air raid warning. According to the instructions, a tap will set the razor for clean and dry. There is a comment not to be afraid if a different sound is later heard. What is not expected, is that after the two blue clean and dry buttons light, the dry button goes out, instead of logically remaining on, until its time comes - and this is followed by gasping noises making one afraid that you have destroyed the razor. Once you have figured it out, the razor is a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Danlex

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't really recommend it. While it can give a pretty close ...
customer_reviews.text: Given the price of this razor, I wouldn't really recommend it. While it can give a pretty close shave, it only does so erratically depending on your whiskers. I returned this one and am trying a Braun 93 series. While the Panasonic was easier to clean, and replacement heads were cheaper, the Braun seems to catch stray hairs better. That being said, if you're a traditional wet shaver thinking either of these is the ticket to electric freedom with as close a shave............. You will be disappointed. Just as I am. In actuality, my old $35 Norelco triple head caught more of my whiskers and gave a closer shave than either of these.
customer_reviews.author: thebuyingpublic

customer_reviews.title: Solid shaver
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I bought this and the negative comments were related to the extra charging/cleaning unit... this didn't come with that... you just plug the shaver into the wall outlet with the cable and it quickly charges. Pretty much all electric shavers aren't a "one swip/perfect shave" like a razor. You have to work it around the face from a couple of angles but in less than 2 minutes, you have a fairly close shave with this unit. It's working great and that's all I expect.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J.

customer_reviews.title: One fatal design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Panasonic razor. My first one is at least 10 years old. Still runs but the battery only lasts a couple shaves now. The best razor I've ever had! My only complaint about this is one design flaw. The foil head is angled which looks great. However, every time I remove it to clean out the stubble the angle is sloped so much that it slips out of my hand. What a hassle now! Did the designers actually test this thing? Since it's such a great razor I couldn't give it 1 star but this was a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: This razor works well and has many nice features.
customer_reviews.text: I shaved with it for the first time and it did quite a good job. I have a tough beard and it comfortly sailed right through it. It seems easy to clean too. My only complaint is that the travel pouch has no room to carry the charger, but having said that, it is a nice, sturdy and rigid pouch. It shaved nice and close in a short shave time. Lots of nice features. A good price for what you get. The unit is comfortable to hold and use. I didn't buy the cleaning systen. It's not really necessary and too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T Bear

customer_reviews.title: Love this shaver
customer_reviews.text: After my previous 'popular brand' shaver wouldn't hold a charge any longer, I tried this Panasonic. I've used this shaver for several months now and I am very happy with the purchase. It shaves close (at least for lighter to moderate whiskers), is super easy to clean with a small brush and popping the top, holds a charge for 10+ days, recharges within 1 hour, has a nice led status indicator, carrying case, and has a nice locking feature when not in use. I thought the price point was excellent compared to similar competition. I am glad I took a chance on the Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: best wet dry razor
customer_reviews.text: I was initially a little skeptical that I would like this better than previous panasonic wet/dry razors I have owned(i have owned 4 others). However I do like it better because of a better and closer as well as quieter shave experience. The only negative is that the head is a bit big making it not ideal for travel but I would travel with it anyway. Additionally I fail to understand why the chargers for the different models cannot be used interchangeably. It seems like this would be an easy feat to accomplish although I claim no expertise in electrical engineering.
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: Better than a blade
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic Arc5 is by far the best electric shaver I've ever used. When used wet, with shaving gel, it gives me a smoother shave than my Gillette or Harry's multi-blade razors. Not just smoother, but quicker and with less skin irritation. Color me impressed by the Arc5 technology. A full charge lasts me about 10 days. And, for what it's worth, you may not wish to spend another $50 or so on a cleaning/charging station. Cleanup is simple and quick: just run the shaver head (with foil guide cap off) under hot water. Charging? The usual wall-plug with a goodly length of cord. Highly recommend the Arc5, whether you're already an electric razor guy or still using blade(s).
customer_reviews.author: John L. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good for Head Shaving
customer_reviews.text: All shavers have trouble with the face and throat area over the first 30 days. This has done a very good job with shaving my head. I used to use a combination of a wahl trimmer and braun 3 series and a gillete fusion blade to shave my head every week. I can shave my head daily and it really feels smoothe. I give it three passes and you can't tell that I didn't use a blade. It is not that hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: VitaTTop Contributor: Sunglasses

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Razor
customer_reviews.text: This razor is the best I've ever used to get the results desired. It shaves my head just like a razor. It's easy to use and easy to clean. It doesn't hurt or causes any nicks, scraps or scratches of any kind. A great value for the price. You can use it wet or dry, with or without shaving cream. I've used it every way but prefer dry. It does work better with shaving cream, but why when you don't have to. I love this product and recommend it to anyone who shaves their head for that smooth bald look.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best electric shaver I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have had over 4 electric shavers over the years, this by far provides one of the closest shavings at the first pass. Didn't need to go over the same spot many times as with other shavers. Also good ergonomics make shaving easy. The only reason I gave only 4 stars is because the motor is kind of loud when compare to other shavers at the same price range, but over all I think is a great product. Glad I bought this shaver over other models I was considering.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Easy/quick shave. Blades worn at 9-12 months.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a dry shave and like it. I didn't care for shaving in the shower (cause I like having a mirror). Don't bother with getting the version with the charger stand/cleaner. Just remove the cover and rinse with water immediately after each shave. I haven't bothered ordering replacement blades for fifty-five bucks given the bad reviews about the lack of sharpness. I just order a whole new razor each December when they are on sale for Christmas for a hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Constant

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic for life
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model that lasted 9 years of shaving 3 times a week. They have definitely improved the cutting technology as this gives me an even smoother shave. Really awesome you can use it in the shower with shaving cream too. I hope this one lasts as long and the cleaning base is a must IMO. Keeps the cutting blades from getting all nasty and causing acne. Best shaver IMO, will pay for itself especially if you have it for 9 years like my last one
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: My old rotary electric razor was old and not performing. So I searched for a good, reasonably priced shaver that worked good. This product was not a rotary shaver so I hesitated to buy it. However, I purchased it and am vey happy with the way it works. I like the floating heads that move with the shape of my face. I am very well pleased. I found electric shavers for less but the reviews were good with this item so I made the purchase. It was not the highest priced item but it was worth the money. Think, how often do we buy an electric razor? not very. SO it was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: cook

customer_reviews.title: Very good shaver
customer_reviews.text: I recently went back to electric after using a razor for about a year. After slicing up my face 3 times in 3 days, I was done. In the past I had a few cheaper electrics that worked pretty well but this time I wanted to get a highly rated, good quality shaver so I chose this Panasonic Arc 5. It really works very well. Virtually as close of a shave as a 5 blade razor but with no cutting up your face. I use shave gel in the shower like I always have. Cleaning recharge unit is nice but not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: mgraze

customer_reviews.title: But this razor of you are looking for a new one!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best electric razor I have ever used!! I have never had a closer shave from an electric razor. This makes me wanna say goodbye to my hand razor for good. Time will tell if it continues, I had a ARC 3, it puts that razor to shame, and I thought that was a good electric razor. But this razor you will be happy you did. I got the base and I would recommend unless you religiously clean after every shave, to get the auto cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: SmokinJoe63

customer_reviews.title: Not working with cable, have to throw away after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the razor. The manual states, that the battery is not replacable (won t be waterproof afterwards anymore). The razor does not work with the cable connected. So.... after 3 years I am supposed to throw away the razor? That is ridiculous. I detest planned obsolescence and will never buy from a company like that again
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Razor
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned about the size as my hands are small but it is lightweight and the handle is not too large. Worked great on 2, 4 and 7 day stubble. Worked even better when I remembered to unlock the head so it could move with the contours of my face! Had not used anything but a blade razor for about 20 years, and this razor made the switch easy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: After months of use the cut is just OK
customer_reviews.text: The battery on this razor is super. It shaves for 2 + minutes per day for 2 weeks or so. Recharges in one hour. Shaved quite well at first but not so great now after 4 months of use. I thought the cutting function was adversely changed after the first time I washed/cleaned the blade head. I did follow directions for cleaning. And there is a reminder light for cleaning. The trimmer works well but is somewhat narrow compared to my previous Panasonic razor.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. L.

customer_reviews.title: OMG!, this is a great shaver!
customer_reviews.text: I used a Norelco Rotary for a half a minute. Went back to the blade. Didn't get a close shave without trying to peel a layer of skin off with that device. But this thing. . .why the heck do they even make rotary shavers when foil shavers work like this? It's amazing. The only con is that the cleaning cycle is loud AF. If you set it to clean before your spouse wakes up, you'll end up having a bad day. Other than that, this thing is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best Shaver I've used in 20years
customer_reviews.text: I have had electric shavers for 20 years. Probably cheaper models. This is hands down the best I have ever used. Cuts great and glides over my face smoothly. Has a lock on the ON button to prevent accidental turn on when traveling. My next shaver will also be a Panasonic. Only drawback is the beard trimmer doesn't do well with my coarse facial hair. It's not been an issue as I have a separate beard trimmer for that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Not for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the braun series 5 to compare. I have sensitive skin on my neck and this razor gave me razor burn equivalent to a traditional razor. It actually cut my neck and it bled! It also was unable to cut flat lying hairs. The braun left no razor burn and easily took care of the flat hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Clayster

customer_reviews.title: Simply The Best!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Philips Norelco user for most of my life,the last one that I had was a piece of junk and was supposed to be their top model went over my face 15 times and still didn’t get all my hairs,then the removable head broke so I threw it away,was looking and came across this Panasonic I bought it and glad I did,this is the best shaver I have ever had just one time across my face literally picks up every hair on my face,so glad I bought this shaver and also bought a Panasonic trimmer.Panasonic is by far the best on the market!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil E

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Shave
customer_reviews.text: This shaver does NOT shave. We purchased for our son, and this shaver just rolls over his hair without cutting at all. Even when switching the head to free-moving, it doesn't cut on the chin/neck, or even on his cheeks where the surface is flat. We have been telling our son to do a better job shaving, but when we watched him do it the other night (and then trying it on myself), it just doesn't cut - at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Close Shave
customer_reviews.text: I've been using electric razors for 30+ years because I hate the hassle of time and mess that a wet razor creates, even though I love the closeness of a wet razor shave. In regards to electric, I've had Philips, Norelco, Remington, and other Panasonic models. Panasonic seems superior. I thought the last Panasonic ES8249 was awesome, but this Arc5 (ES-LV65-S) is amazing. It's the best electric shave I've ever had, extremely close and comparable to a wet razor shave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a near blade result
customer_reviews.text: Works well. There a lot of good reviews on Panasonic shavers. For me the most important consideration that this does a great job on my moderately heavy beard, but it does take me 6-8 minutes to shave as a result. Nothing else I have tried works anywhere near as well as the Panasonic. I have tried two of the newer Braun’s but they do not get close compared to the Panasonic. The only thing better than the Panasonic is a blade, but even then, blades do not last me more than a few shaves. Way too expensive and too much hassle. I’ll stick with my Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I had a 2 year old Norelco Rotary Shaver and it wasn't cutting well. I ordered replacement heads from Amazon and the performance did not improve. So I ditched the unit. I ordered the Panasonic ES-LV95-S and what a difference. This shaver is excellent. I love it. The Panasonic cuts smoothly all over my face. With the Norelco I had trouble under my nose especially. The Panasonic cuts the hair under my nose smoothly with little effort. The Norelco, even when it was new I had to go back and fourth and still could not get a smooth cut. Try the Panasonic, you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Dimaio

customer_reviews.title: I was a little skeptical, but not any more.
customer_reviews.text: Ordering something as important as a shaver makes me a little nervous, but I did it anyway. My husband cannot shave himself, so I do it. I wanted something that would be gentle to his skin and yet get a shave that would last at least 2-3 days. This one is perfect. I enjoy using it and getting the shave he needs. The edge trimmer is great and I like how easy it is to clean. He's never had a shaver that could be put under water. What a great upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lena Lee

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further!  This Is The Only Electric Razor You'll Ever Need!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a blade shaved for the last 10 years after using a Norelco for 20 years. I tried a Braun after and no electric shaver was cutting close enough. Since I am tired of my sensitive skin being irritated by the blade I began searching for a new electric one. After MUCH deliberation the reviews for this Panasonic Arc5 made my mind up! It is the closest shave of any electric razor out there! After using it the first time I couldn't believe how good it felt! I can skip a day and still feels good! I actually enjoy and genuinely look forward to shaving!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Shaver.
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman with facial hair. I have been shaving since I was a teenager. Of course I went through a lifetime of cuts & trying to hide them. Being embarrassed because of them. I am now 78 years old & still doing this. I just love this razor. Shaves close without nicks or cuts. I bought this model because the comments were better for this model then the newer ones. Besides that it was a better price. If you can't tell I highly recommend this shavor.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this razor. I am biased as I have only owned Panasonic razors over the years. My previous razor died after ten years of service. It was also a Panasonic and did a good job. This one does a great job! Very close shave and easy around the curves of your face. You only need to go over areas one time with all the blades it has. It charges quickly and is very quiet. The lock switch is going to be nice when I put it in a bag and don't have to worry about it being clicked on.
customer_reviews.author: Jove

customer_reviews.title: Does good job
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of the electric razors I've owned over my life. All just burned my face and left all the whiskers on my neck. Had to try one once more. Well this one does well with my every 2-3 day shave schedule. I still have to drag the trimmer on the back across my neck a few times to get those hair growing sideways before shaving, but it gets the job done without much burn. The self cleaning stand is large but cleans this razor really well. I am using their detergent. Not bad for a $150.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J Leybourn

customer_reviews.title: Plastic head clips break..
customer_reviews.text: Shaver brook after 15 months..Panasonic warnity is junk..lost a lot of money..Uses plastic clips to hold the head on..
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Combs

customer_reviews.title: Push hair into skin 👎👎
customer_reviews.text: Waist of money. It’s not really a smooth shaving. True you will not feel any hair after you shave with this razor but take a look in the mirror it actually push the hair back into your skin. It makes my face all look all black because it push the small beard back into your skin 👎👎
customer_reviews.author: Wissam

customer_reviews.title: The razor to end all razors
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find a good electric razor to shave my head with and have been disappointed with most. I figured I would give the 5 blade Panasonic (my favorite razor brand) a try even though it was more than I wanted to spend. It does not disappoint! The motor is significantly quieter than most other electric razors and it cuts the hair on my head to as close to baby bottom smooth as possible. I haven't tried it on my facial hair as I have found that I like using a straight razor for my face. The straight razor results in no razor burn so I am sticking with it. I would highly recommend the Panasonic Arc5!
customer_reviews.author: Craig L. Cornish

customer_reviews.title: The best electric shaver I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few foil shavers, but have always gone back to a Norelco rotary shaver. I've owned several of them over the last few decades and they gave me a pretty good shave -- the best electric shaver available, or so I thought. UNTIL NOW. The Panasonic Arc5 (ES-LV65-S) gives me a much closer shave. I can even skip a day, where I could not with the Norelco. It is easier to clean thoroughly with a little liquid soap applied to the head, running it a few seconds, then rinsing it under a running faucet. Looks very well designed and constructed. I hope they still make them when it comes time for a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Barry MD

customer_reviews.title: Great buy !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write reviews, but felt the need for this. I generally use a straight razor to shave as I like a really close shave. Double edge sword though cause I have sensitive skin. I can not shave two days in a row however , my job requires me too. I had a baun for when i has to shave in between or when I was too lazy to shave. It recently died on me after 6years. I bought this one and after my first shave I must say it is amazing . You truly get the close shave they claim. I was skeptical. It’s close, and doesn’t irritate my skin at all. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing closeness
customer_reviews.text: This razor shaves as close as a blade. If you're coming from a multihead razor, you are simply not going to believe the way this thing works - the difference is incredible. With my old razor (Philips Norelco AT830/41 Shaver 4500), I had a shadow as soon as I finished shaving. With this, my skin is as smooth as can be. And at $100 less than the Braun, this product is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Reader from Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Bought this for my husband because he’s in the military and has to shave every day no matter what. He has sensitive skin and regular razors were tearing up his face and giving him awful angry razor burn and ingrown hairs. It took a while but his face has finally calmed down and smoothed out. It’s hard finding electric razors that get a close enough shave considered acceptable and within regs for the military, so far he’s been very happy and says it’s near comparable to a razor shave
customer_reviews.author: summergirl098

customer_reviews.title: Dream Machine
customer_reviews.text: Just received the ARC5 today and tried it out immediately. What a close shave! I am impressed with the quality and function of this electric shaver. Bought the one without the cleaner but has the travel case. The shaver does not need the the $50 cleaning system because all you need to do is squirt some liquid hand soap, turn on the cleaning function and bam it’s done. For me the travel case and included charging cable is more important for travel. I love this shaver and look forward to many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Y. Sakai

customer_reviews.title: Millitary shave
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the millitary 12 years and have torn up my face shaving with a normal razor. This one is a solid choice with a close shave for face and head, only small complaint is it left a few hairs on the curve of my neck but that’s was it. Overall a good razor
customer_reviews.author: M&C

customer_reviews.title: ARC5 ES-LV95-S
customer_reviews.text: I have tried the rotary electric razors in the past and was very unsatisfied in the results of the shave plus making my face raw. This razor is truly AMAZING. close comfortable shave, battery charge good for days on end before needing recharge and I purchased the cleaning station ( which is not necessary since it can be cleaned under running water) but is a nice addition and is in my opinion a more thorough cleaning process.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ray

customer_reviews.title: A great razor for guys who shave their heads
customer_reviews.text: I use this to shave my head in the shower once per week. I had a cheaper version of a Panasonic razor before this, and it was great for four years. My routine was to do a little pre-trim, then shave my head in the shower, then do touch up with a manual razor. But with this razor it is all just one step. Don't misunderstand, I have to take several passes during my shave. But it is the smoothest shave I have ever experienced. I love the cleaning process and charger, too. I have been shaving with this over six weeks now and it has actually gotten better in that time. Amazing product worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Razor I ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is best Razor I ever used so far. I have admit that my older one was budget razor, so I don't have too much experience with all other razors, but so far this is the best. Shave closely very fast with no bite. It tells me how much time I spent for shaving and battery life that's left. Also it tells me when to clean and I just need to use some liquid soap and wash it water. Although it's not perfect (it sometimes doesn't get few coiled beard), but it does the job. It makes shaving time enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great, Smooth Shave Quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the smoothest shavers I've had. I've had Norelco, Remington and Panasonic. This latest design combines the technology of Lithium Ion charging with the smooth microblade action of a good shave and easy to hold and clean. My only issue - and, to be fair, it's a reoccurring issue with all the electric shavers - is the travel case design never allows an additional place to carry / house the recharging cord and plug-in. It'd be nice to see one day an electric shaver meet all the real tests of a good shave AND the needs of a traveling hard case that worked. Just my own peeve.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Olsen

product_meta.title: Panasonic Arc5 Electric Razor, Men's 5-blade Cordless with shave sensor technology and Wet/Dry Convenience, ES-LV65-S
product_meta.description: Style Name:LV65 Electric ShaverThe fully loaded Panasonic Electric Shaver and Trimmer for Men, ES-LV65-S Arc5, Wet/Dry with 5 Nanotech Blades and Flexible Pivoting Head, is packed with smart, innovative features that deliver a remarkably close and comfortable shave. The ES-LV65-S electric razor is a five-blade shaving system for outstanding shaver coverage and closeness, and features an active shaving sensor to detect different beard densities as you shave and adjust cutting power where needed for the ultimate in smooth, even and comfortable results. Panasonic Arc5 men's shavers feature 30-degree angle blades to cut hair at its base for close, accurate precision. The multi-flex pivoting head allows the cordless shaver to float effortlessly along the contours of your face for a clean shave, especially around your sideburns and under your chin. The Panasonic shaver has a fast, high-efficiency 14,000 cpm linear motor to help eliminate the tugging and pulling that may occur with slower electric razors, while maintaining peak power right up until the end of the charge. The convenient wet/dry design lets you shave and trim in the shower or bath with foam, gel or soap lather and dry by holding under warm water to rinse away hair stubble and residue. The Panasonic ES-LV65-S men's five-blade electric shaving system with Nanotech blades comes equipped with a travel pouch, hypoallergenic blades and foils for sensitive skin, a pop-up shaving trimmer, and an AC recharger with universal voltage.
feature_bullets: Sharp men’s shaver blades: Panasonic Arc5 men's electric shaver with five ultra sharp precision honed 30° Nanotech blades and ultra-thin Arc foil follow facial contours for a quick, close and comfortable shave
Wet/Dry electric shaver and trimmer 2 in 1: Built-in pop up trimmer details mustaches, beards and sideburns; Wet/dry waterproof shaver allows for convenient shaving in or out of the shower

Multi Flex pivoting head: Panasonic flexible pivoting electric shaver head glides effortlessly to trace the individual contours of face, chin, neck and jaw; Built in shaving sensor monitors differences in beard density and automatically adjusts cutting power for exceptional comfort

High performance motor with a linear drive: This Panasonic shaver is equipped with a linear motor which delivers 14,000 cuts per minute (70,000 crosscutting actions per minute) and maintains peak power up to the end of every battery charge
LCD Battery Indicator: The shaver’s 10 stage LCD shows battery status at a glance; Rechargeable, portable and travel friendly
Note: Kindly refer user guide for trouble shooting tips
